task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 71°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

raw_response: {"THOUGHT":"I need to see the full facade and roofline of the main building ahead to estimate height, so I should tilt up while keeping the same heading.","ACTION":"ROTATION(0,30)"}

reason: My view is now pointing north and up, but the target building should be to the east (~71°), so I should rotate right to align with it while keeping the upward pitch to see the roofline.
To estimate the building height accurately I need to capture the top of the facade/roof against the sky, so I should tilt up while staying on the same heading.
The view keeps snapping back to 0° after pitching up, so I should rotate right to face ~71°E while keeping the current upward pitch to see the building top.
If the pitch-up isn’t sticking, I should instead move closer to the building to better gauge number of floors and facade scale for a height estimate.
I’m now facing north, but the building of interest is to the east, so I should rotate right to bring the main facade into view for height estimation.
Now aligned east toward the building, I should look up to include the roofline and estimate floors/overall height.
Pitching up again reset my heading to north, so I need to rotate right back to east while keeping the upward pitch to capture the building top.
Since the pitch control is glitching, I’ll estimate height from the visible facade at level pitch by counting apparent floors and typical floor-to-floor height.
